name: Yonezu Kenshi
bio: Kenshi Yonezu (米津 玄師, Yonezu Kenshi) is a Japanese musician, singer-songwriter, record producer and illustrator who began releasing Vocaloid music under the stage name Hachi (ハチ) in 2009. In 2012, he debuted under his real name, releasing music with his own voice. He sold 4.2 million physical copies and more than 7 million digital copies in Japan.

name: Daoko
bio: Daoko (だをこ, stylized as DAOKO, born 4 March 1997) is a Japanese female singer and rapper born in Tokyo. She started her career when one of her uploaded videos on Nico Nico Douga received attention at the age of 15 in 2012.

name: Aimyon
bio: あいみょん (aimyon) is a Japanese singer-songwriter (born 1995) from Nishinomiya, Hyogo Prefecture.

name: RADWIMPS
bio: RADWIMPS is a Japanese rock band consisting of Yojiro Noda on vocals, guitar, and piano, Akira Kuwahara on guitar, Yusuke Takeda on bass, and Satoshi Yamaguchi on drums, who debuted independently in 2003 and later on major label in 2005.

name: Masaki Suda
bio: 菅田将暉 (Masaki Suda) is a well-known Japanese actor and singer, currently signed with TOP COAT. He debuted as an actor by playing the character of "Kamen Rider W" in 2009. He then debuted as a singer with "見たこともない景色 (Mita Koto mo Nai Keshiki)", which is au publicity theme song.

name: Ikimono Gakari
bio: いきものがかり (Ikimonogakari) is a three-piece co-ed Japanese band that was formed in February 1999 by Hotaka Yamashita (山下穂尊) and Yoshiki Mizuno (水野良樹) in Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan - vocalist Kiyoe Yoshioka (吉岡聖恵) was added in December of 1999.
